data.title: Best taco shop in downtown Gilbert!
data.text: Love everything about this place.  Food is amazing & atmosphere is great.  It's such a relaxed vibe, so welcoming.  All the servers are great too!

data.title: Sunshine and Football!
data.text: Great lunch seated outside SoCal Taco Co in Gilbert. Craft beers suggested by our waiter John were spot on, and our lunch was phenomenal!  Great seafood tamale, clam strips and locos tacos!  We will return sooner than later!

data.title: Why haven't I gone here sooner?
data.text: This restaurant is one I have often driven by and soon forgot about it... saying, I want to try it some day.... Well today was that day!! I had the Mahi Mahi and a Grouper taco both were fantastic!!  The fish is flown in every other day and the taste was fresh as could be!!! I wish I would have gone here sooner!!

data.title: Tasty fish tacos!!!
data.text: Love the food! Wait staff is friendly. Love the patio out back. It is not that expensive and the food is fresh and tasty!

data.title: Best Tacos in AZ
data.text: Tacos are AMAZING and the seafood tamale is one of the best things I have ever eaten. Beer selection is good and wait staff is tremendous!

data.title: Best Tacos Ever
data.text: This is a must try place in Gilbert, locally owned and operated. They offer the best of Southern California eats in the desert. The dishes are the right sized portion and have the right amount of seasoning. My personal favorite is the Corona Beer battered fish tacos. Huge covered patio with fans and misters to keep you cool in the summer heat.

data.title: Great Food and Great Service!
data.text: Excellent Service by their staff. The food is Amazing. It was my first time here on business  and Iwould definitely come back with my family.

data.title: A Hidden (In Plain Sight) Seafood Gem!
data.text:
Tried So Cal prior to attending a show at The Hale Theater - we were not disappointed!
Very tiny inside (seats about 24), but a HUGE patio out back with misters and lots of fans!
Very casual - paper plates, plastic cups and utensils, but don't let this stop you - the seafood is delicious! I can recommend the Fried Clam Strips and Peel and Eat Shrimp -
this was our first visit  - but won't be our last!

data.title: Great place to eat.
data.text: Not just fish tacos, other things on the menu and all are good. Have gone with a group of ten and everyone liked what they had. Good food and service.

data.title: Calamari is fantastic!
data.text: We had lunch while my mom was visiting.  It was my second time at SoCal and both times our food was delicious!  We shared ceviche and clam chowder as appetizers and both were delicious.  I had calamari as my entree.  I order calamari every time I see it on the menu, this is not the rubbery calamari rings but the strips.  It was outstanding!  We had all recently been to another Gilbert seafood restaurant for a birthday celebration, higher $$$ but felt this meal was better and more reasonably priced.  I love the ambiance of the small place, it has a definite beach restaurant feeling.  I deducted one star because I don't love the disposable plates, etc.

data.title: Great Happy Hour Menu
data.text: We visited the SoCal Fish Taco Co. during happy hour (Mon-Fri 3-6pm) because we wanted to give it a try without spending a small fortune.  My husband had the Cod Tacos for $2 and I ordered the Peel and East Shrimp for $4.50.  The shrimp was fresh and delicious, my husband said he would have the tacos again. We then ordered the coconut shrimp for $4.50 to share and ended up ordering another order because it was so delicious.  The only down side was I ordered a glass of wine and it was served in plastic.  I dislike the taste that plastic gives to wine.  If we had eaten outside I would have understood the plastic,  but we ate inside.  The happy hour menu is a great way to check it out and will bring you back for more.  Looking forward to our next visit

data.title: Wide variety of tacos
data.text: An up-scale fast food taco restaurant.  Many choices of fish to choose from.  Ambience is quaint, but still it's unappealing having plastic utensils

data.title: Fish tacos!
data.text: They have a nice small menu!! Fish tacos are really good!! Also I have enjoyed there fish and chips!!

data.title: Fish tacos any way you want!
data.text: We visited for an early Saturday lunch with 5 adults and 2 kids. There was something for everyone to choose from. Most of us choose variations of the fish tacos and the kids had chicken fingers & fries. Everyone was happy. The fish is really fresh. We ate outside as the inside doesn't have room for a larger group. Our server was not the most attentive and he forgot requested items. However all in all we were all pleased and would return to try the salads, wraps, fresh oysters and clam chowder.

data.title: Great Tacos, Great Owners
data.text: If in the charming downtown Gilbert, AZ area, and its lunch time...and you like tacos...do yourself a favor and swing in to this place. It's smaller than the main street business's but it is so worth it. It is a family owned and operated business and the care comes through to your experience. The lunch we had was 6 different tacos a la carte (so don't hesitate to try em all). We started with amazing ceviche tostadas, killer beginning. This Uncle and Nephew team were great, and the food was too. What gets better than fresh fish tacos and a cold beer on a warm day. I highly recommend the lobster taco and the shark.

data.title: Good Fish Sandwiches.
data.text: They have inside and patio seating.  As it was a gorgeous day we sat on the patio which was very relaxing.  The fish sandwiches were of good portion and delicious.

data.title: Where's the Rice and Beans???
data.text: Service was a little slow and it wasn't even busy.   Small inside seating.  Outside picnic tables.  Plenty of parking in the back.  Fish tacos are slightly bigger than the street tacos.  Very small potions of rice and beans.  Good size carne asada salad.   No Taco Tuesday specials.  :(

data.title: Great Fish
data.text: Will be back. Enjoyed Fish and Chips. Tasty and Hot. The Chips (also know as fries) were just about perfect. I could have ordered a second order, but ....... The service was really good on an evening just after the end of the performance of Anything Goes at the nearby  Hale Theatre. Lots of people everywhere.

data.title: Excellent food and service!
data.text: Had heard the fish tacos were good, let's just say amazing!!! Swordfish and grouper we enjoyed thoroughly!!! Started w crab cakes!!! To die for and their homemade tartar sauce could be sold in containers!!! Sat outside, very clean, very quiet, and shade or sun if you like! Family, couples or groups friendly. Not too forget the super margaritas!! Don't change a thing! Going back again soon!!! Salsa also amazing! Enjoy!!

data.title: Nice location/area, food decent
data.text: We met friends for a late lunch, ate on patio with about four tables occupied. John, our server, was fun & gave us good service.  The Mahi Mahi tacos were great, ahi tuna tacos okay.  We were satisfied with food & we understand why many folks really like this place.
